posts.body:
>>d999436f-f942-4341-a1f2-87963aa1e7e3
If I wanted to build a RPi seexbox for ZeroNet, how would I protect myself without penalizing performance? Would encrypting the HDD work or would it slow down too much? Is RPi even recommended, or is there other hardware more suited for it within the price range?

>>cae8090e-9857-4d42-943a-c0bddd36622f
It may also have a memory leak somewhere. I forgot I had the tab open and just let it run, it ate all of my RAM and I had to reset. Just now I verified it was the frontpage doing it. I let it get to 1GiB, then closed it, and the memory was released completely by the browser.

>>089a3848-858b-4c90-8a41-4fb52319280b
>but I put zeronet files on mfs partition(memory filesystem)
But that wouldn't help me if I actually wanted to seed, right? Since the purpose would be to store the data in a permanent way.

I'll look into the board you suggested.

posts.subject: Allright everyone
posts.body:
>looks like 8chan has been banned from the internet, probably some democrat on twitter complaining again about the nazis, the internet nazis that will kill you, so yeah and they will probably come for 4chan next, well good luck with that, they will just move somewhere else, and that was exactly what 8chan did so they moved to the zeronet which is basically a decentralized network that is hosted by its own users which means it can't be shut down, so yeah those blue checkmarks on twitter shot themselves in the foot and now they just can't do anything about it peace out

How long until the gardener makes this video?
